description: Borrowed from French radium, from rad(ioactif) (“radioactive”)  +‎ -ium (suffix used to form the names of metallic elements).

entries.meaning: The chemical element (symbol Ra) with an atomic number of 88. It is a soft, shiny and silvery radioactive alkaline earth metal.
(textiles, dated) A type of cloth woven from silk or synthetic yarn, often with a shiny appearance.

verbs.description: radium (third-person singular simple present radiums, present participle radiuming, simple past and past participle radiumed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, obsolete) To treat (a tumour, etc.) with radium.
